django.contrib.staticfiles.management.commands.findstatic
=========================================================

.. py:module:: django.contrib.staticfiles.management.commands.findstatic


Classes
-------

.. autoapisummary::

   django.contrib.staticfiles.management.commands.findstatic.Command


Module Contents
---------------

.. py:class:: Command(stdout=None, stderr=None, no_color=False, force_color=False)

   Bases: :py:obj:`django.core.management.base.LabelCommand`


   A management command which takes one or more arbitrary arguments
   (labels) on the command line, and does something with each of
   them.

   Rather than implementing ``handle()``, subclasses must implement
   ``handle_label()``, which will be called once for each label.

   If the arguments should be names of installed applications, use
   ``AppCommand`` instead.


   .. py:attribute:: help
      :value: 'Finds the absolute paths for the given static file(s).'



   .. py:attribute:: label
      :value: 'staticfile'



   .. py:method:: add_arguments(parser)

      Entry point for subclassed commands to add custom arguments.



   .. py:method:: handle_label(path, **options)

      Perform the command's actions for ``label``, which will be the
      string as given on the command line.
